channel.title: Pan Flute on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Pan Flute on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Art, Commerce, and Zamfir
item.description: Today in Tedium: When I grew up, I listened to a lot of John Denver. Well, not really full songs, so much as the 10-second snippets of tunes that played during his commercials on late-night cable TV. “You fill up my senses like a night in the forest,” Denver sang to the masses, even though he was really only singing to Annie, his first wife. But those choruses and hooks had a way of bleeding together into one super-song.
